name: Red Pepper Mousse
keywords: drained yogurt, red bell pepper, thyme, white wine vinegar, yogurt, low calorie, low-fat
recipeIngredient: 2 large red bell peppers, seeded, deveined and cut into large dice
1 small clove garlic, peeled and bruised
1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste
1 teaspoon freshly ground pepper, plus more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Put the peppers, garlic, thyme, salt and pepper in a nonstick skillet. Sprinkle with the vinegar, partly cover and cook over medium-low heat until the peppers are tender but not soft, about 25 minutes.

Puree the mixture in a food processor or blender until smooth. Strain through a sieve lined with cheesecloth. Fold in the yogurt cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste. This mousse can be stored in the refrigerator in a closed container for up to 3 days. Serve with grilled bread or as a base for pasta salad.
